messages.body: $TSLA SP up 4 points at 7:00am.    Bought land in China.   Stock price will double in two years easily.

$TSLA Why do these frauds keep recycling the same BS China pump when the stock crashes? Seems like a China factory is built every yr. 2016: https://mashable.com/2016/06/24/tesla-factory-china-9-billion/#VBcqsKKMiaq6

links.title: Tesla signs $9 billion agreement to build factory in China, report says
links.description: Tesla Motors has reportedly signed a non-binding agreement with Chinese government-owned company Jinqiao Group to construct a Tesla production plant in the city of Shanghai. All told, the investment could cost $9 billion, a person close to the matter told Bloomberg .

messages.body: $TSLA https://cleantechnica.com/2018/10/17/tesla-pushes-to-improve-service-center-coverage-density-as-model-3-deliveries-climb-elontweets/ 🏎🚀

links.title: Tesla Pushes To Improve Service Center Coverage Density As Model 3 Deliveries Climb #ElonTweets
links.description: Tesla CEO @ElonMusk took to Twitter to admit that Tesla had found some gaps in its global service center coverage and is now hard at work to improve its coverage over the next 3-6 months. Specifically, Elon shared that Tesla would push to ensure full coverage of North America with its service centers over the next 3-6 months.

messages.body: $TSLA secures 860,000 sq.meter Shanghai site for $2 Billion China Gigafactory with annual capacity of 500,000 cars. https://finance.yahoo.com/news/tesla-signs-agreement-shanghai-gigafactory-092113358.html

links.title: Tesla secures Shanghai site for $2 billion China Gigafactory
links.description: Tesla Inc has signed an agreement with the Shanghai government for an 860,000 square meter plot of land to build its first overseas Gigafactory, the electric carmaker said in a Chinese social media post on Wednesday.

links.title: Tesla signs agreement in Shanghai for gigafactory site
links.description: BEIJING (Reuters) - Tesla Inc has signed an agreement with the Shanghai government for an 860,000 square meter plot of land to build its first overseas Gigafactory, the electric carmaker said in a Chinese social media post on Wednesday.
